intro: Aiouea alainii, commonly known as the Tahitian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves with a smooth texture and emits a subtle fragrance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
